title: I'd honestly rather play with potty-mouths that actually try.
body:
Than the people who do things mechanically to **literally ruin** the game. You can mute an annoying toxic who keeps complaining, you can't do anything against someone who intentionally ruins your games because they want to be selfish.

_Game a few days ago._
Mid feeds 0/7/0. Freaks out and says the whole GG thing, surrenders.
We tell him no, other lanes are ahead and we're fine, we've even won two team fights. 
"Yeah but I keep dying in them and am not doing anything im useless and not having fun just surrender and let me go to another game." After refusing to surrender he decides to tell us "Well if you're not gonna let me leave I'm just gonna feed them more so we lose faster so I can get this over with."
** Which he follows through with. Fast forward to today, he's still playing.
**
_Go to yesterday: _
Our top says he has some lag, we tell him just play safe then and try not to engage too much. 
"Nah, I can't play like this have fun guys." AFK's before level 2, he's the only tank on our team, and it tilts our JG who now has to take over top with a machete, we get stomped.
EVERYONE on our team and enemy team says they're going to report him because the game was such a boring steamroll. 
**Again, dude is still playing. **

The only way I can view this kind of behavior/punishment system is the kid in class says a curse word so he gets a weeks worth of detention. The bully beating the **** out of kids in between periods goes un-punished, because a teacher doesn't actually see it happen and are too lazy to investigate.

I'd rather be in a class with a kid who's annoying than be afraid to go outside of class because I'm afraid of the bully who's going to beat the **** out of me.

Not many people would disagree with this. It is a useless sentiment and a false dichotomy, though. You do not ever get to choose. If you got to choose you would choose the nice guy who is also good. Being nice/toxic doesn't have any impact on how good you are at the game.

I think his point is that people that intentionally troll you to lose aren't punished, but people that call them out on it are. I got the sense that he was implying trolling should actually be punished as strictly as "toxic" chat is.

Trolling is already punished more harshly than toxic chat. Chat infractions get 4 chances unless they are severe, griefing gets 14 day and permanent bans. The issues with trolling are detection and gaining enough certainty that it is intentional since you aren't really judging their actions in most cases but their intentions. There are so many subtle ways to grief someone that will just never be punished because they can always feign innocence. The community also doesn't help itself with trolls either. So many people call everyone who does anything wrong or that they disagree with a troll.

>Trolling is already punished more harshly than toxic chat

Meh, then you wouldn't be able to look up the people trolling and see that they continue to play. I've literally had people admit they were trolling in chat and not be punished.

I'm always a bit curious about stories like this because the few trolls I have run into all got punished or I guess had conveniently time breaks immediately following the time I got a response to my ticket.

Do you give detailed reports about what happened or just check unsportsmanlike and move on?
I've clicked unsportsmanlike, intentionally feeding, and then wrote in the chat box. Then I've submitted support tickets asking why nothing was done.
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAMEN

I completely agree.
This problem is also exacerbated by how often it happens. 5 game promotion series are almost impossible for me because I am guaranteed to run into at least one of these intentional feeders in one of my 5 games.

It took me 6 tries to get into Platinum V. I spent more time hovering at 90 LP in Gold I than the time I took to climb from Silver III to Gold I.
I should have won my promos on the first try, but of course I played with a Graves ADC who insists on engaging team fights by themselves.
In my second series, I had a Malphite who kept flaming everyone on my team for "poor" plays. However, he is the sole reason we didn't win the game at 20 minutes. Every time someone makes a misplay, he would engage 1 v 5 just to show how "stupid" we were. 

Just on my most recent series, I had a fed Shvyana who overestimated her ability and engaged on every fight by herself instead of letting the actual tanks do it.
The Shvyana was on Platinum promos as well, and she blamed her team for losing that game.

Frankly I have no idea how these people even function in real life. I've been playing a lot of Shen lately just so I can prevent these players from killing themselves and flaming their teams for their deaths. 
As far as I know, all of these players who intentionally fed are still playing. Riot does almost nothing to stop them. Even in high Gold/low Plat, the chances of being matched with the same players again are quite high outside of peak times on Fridays and weekends. At this point I just save all the names of players who are prone to intentionally feed in a text file so I can dodge if I get matched with them again.

I think if rito would get enough common sense to punish the type of player in your examples, then they would see an actual improvement in their "toxicity" problem. Because lord forbid one of your teammates told them to stop trolling, BAM! Reported and punished. I wonder how long it's going to take them to realize that their current method of ignoring the causes simply doesn't work. Been about 2.5 seasons thus far.
